thread.title: NTSB investigating Vermont Amtrak derailment - Nation
thread.title_full: NTSB investigating Vermont Amtrak derailment - Nation

author: Adam Vaccaro
title: NTSB investigating Vermont Amtrak derailment - Nation
text:
The National Transportation Safety Board is investigating why an Amtrak train derailed in rural Vermont Monday.
According to NTSB spokesman Eric Weiss, the investigation will focus on the tracks, inspection records, weather, any video recordings in the cab of the train, and survival factors, which refers to things like impact forces and evacuation, according to the NTSBâ€™s website .
Related Link Amtrak train derails in Vermont The results of an investigation generally take months to produce, Weiss said.
 The derailment sent three of five cars over an embankment and caused seven injuries Monday. The train is thought to have hit a rock slide on the tracks.
All seven injured have been released from the hospital, according to the Associated Press . The tracks are in the process of being cleared, with hopes for the line to be reopened by the weekend, the AP reports.
